name: Corroded Ocean Bullet Jewelry
description:
Handmade & designed with bullets found on the beach, naturally patinaed by the sea and tumbled in the surf of Canada's west coast. Necklaces available for purchase: www.sandoverslyjewelry.com/product/beach-found-bullet-casing-necklace

www.sandoverslyjewelry.com/product/beach-found-bullet-casing-crystal-pendant-on-leather-necklace

Please direct your questions to: sandoverslydesign@gmail.com :) www.facebook.com/slyjewelry

name: White Sea Glass, Solid Copper & Brown Leather Tassle Bracelet
description:
A nice & simple cuff made with perfectly smooth white sea glass, beach found copper wire, copper chain, locally hand cut brown leather and a handmade leather tassle.

One of a kind and beautiful showcase of the sea glass, this bracelet would make a great gift for a sea glass lover.

Made with sea glass collected and drilled by myself; found on the beaches of Canada's West Coast. Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada.

*Bracelet worn by model is similar, but not the same bracelet*

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

name: Rare Bright Rainbow Sea Glass Bracelet
description:
Amazing bracelet of rainbow coloured sea glass. The bright & luminous sea glass on this bracelet is rare and hard to find on the beach.

I found the sea glass on the bracelet on various beaches on Canada's west coast, Vancouver Island, Canada.

This bracelet includes, bright red, lemon yellow, lime green, bright cyan, aqaumarine, cornflower blue and true purple sea glass!

A pretty, antique white fresh water pearl dangles off the chain. On this bracelet here are seven very rare pieces of beautiful sea glass!

I get happy each time I look at it and I feel it will do that same for you!

Finding & chain are brass. It's is easily adjustable & very beautiful. All sea glass on this piece and all my jewelry were hand drilled and collected by myself.

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

name: Lovely Little Pink Beach Pottery and Pearl Earrings
description:
Pretty, little pieces of pink beach pottery with peach pink fresh water pearls and white stick fresh water pearls.

The sea pottery I found on the beaches of British Columbia's west coast on the Southern end of Vancouver Island. The fresh water stick pearls are actually from an antique pearl and lapis necklace of my Grandmother's that sadly broke. These earrings bring new life to these once broken elements.

They are one of a kind, classy & with a bit of an edge.

Eco-friendly, green jewelry! 

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

A gorgeous and bold combination of cobalt blue, cornflower blue, turquoise & seafoam sea glass. This bracelet is a unique creation hand-crafted with beachcombed seaglass, copper chain & findings & an aquamarine gemstone. 

Found on various beaches on Canada's west coast, Vancouver Island, Canada, all sea glass on this piece were collected & hand drilled by the artist herself. Drilling multiple holes in the sea glass is not easy and takes a steady hand and lots of patience.

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

name: Purple Hearts - Lilac Sea Glass & Fresh Water Pearl Earrings
description:
Earrings hand-crafted with pretty pale purple / lilac sea glass found on the west coast.  Heart shaped brass charms with beautiful pink fresh water pearls. They are quite charming.

Purple sea glass in uncommon and a really lovely phenomenon.
The glass in items like jars, pressed glass decorations and bottles was once made stronger with manganese. After years of direct sunlight the glass actually turns from clear to purple coloured.

Made with sea glass collected and drilled by myself; found on the beaches of Canada's West Coast. Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada.

Created with lead & nickle free antique brass findings & chain.

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Made with beach melt (bonfire) sea glass in a very unusual shade... purple! I collected the seaglass myself on a rugged beach on Canada's West Coast. Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. (Near Victoria, B.C.) Bonfire sea glass in a pale purple shade is very rare.

Gemstones on this dangling charm bracelet are turquoise in varying shades, peridot, aquamarine, fresh water pearl and jade. 

Bonfire glass is sea glass that was melted in a beach fire or structure fire years and years ago and then tumbled in the waves and tide.

Solid copper findings and chains with a lobster claw clasp. 

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

name: Rare Bright Red Sea Glass, Turquoise & African Trade Bead Earrings
description:
Wicked, made of rare materials and one of a kind. Hand-crafted earrings created with west coast found bright red sea glass, turquoise gemstone, african trade beads and copper chain & findings. 

They are very interesting and unique, a great conversation piece.

Red glass is a hard to colour to create. The easiest and stablest way is using gold. Therefore it is and was in the past crafted in smaller amounts then almost any other colour, making red sea glass extremely hard to find. Red sea glass is most often from car tail lights or nautical lamps and lanterns.

The rare red sea glass was found by the artist herself on the beaches of Canada's West Coast, British Columbia, Canada.  (Near Victoria, B.C.)

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

description:
Amazing bracelet with beautiful rare red sea glass.  Red glass is a hard to colour to create. The easiest and stablest way is using gold. Therefore it is and was in the past crafted in smaller amounts then almost any other colour, making red sea glass extremely hard to find. Red sea glass is most often from car tail lights or nautical lamps and lanterns.

The four amazing rare red pieces of sea glass on this bracelet were found by me on the beaches of Canada's West Coast, British Columbia, Canada. There is bright red, deep cherry and ruby red sea glass. Amazing! I then drilled them for the bracelet.

description:
This sea glass necklace is wonderful. Jewel like pieces of turquoise, seafoam, irredesent and amethyst colored sea glass. Including bonfire sea glass all crackled and brightly coloured.

This one of a kind, handmade sea glass necklace features some of the pretty shades of sea glass. 

Teardrops of sea glass dangle from antiqued brass findings.

-

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

Handmade in Victoria on Vancouver Island, West Coast of British Columbia, Canada.

name: Moss Green Sea Glass & Vintage Brass Bar Earrings
description:
This pair of earrings are one of a kind; made with deep moss / olive coloured sea glass from the beaches of Canada's westcoast.

Solid brass links, antique brass earwires and vintage brass links from a necklace.

Gorgeous, very well tumbled green seaglass in this colour is uncommon and not found too often of the beach. Such lovely earrings. They are over 3.5" in length.

All sea glass I use in my jewelry is found by myself on the beaches of Canada's west coast. I then selected these pieces for the necklace and carefully drilled them using a diamond bit.

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted with quality materials and with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery. Made with sustainability and the earth in mind.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

Please ask any questions you have in the 'Contact' section or direct them to: 
sandoverslydesign@gmail.com

name: Red Sea Glass, Evil Eye and Brass Cuff
description:
A beautiful, smooth piece of red sea glass along side a wonderful fused glass eye set in dark blue & red leather. Hammered brass cuff / bangle with brass findings and links.

This one of a kind bracelet features the glass work of Victoria, B.C. based artisan Sarah Mulligan. (Sea glass from the Island and glass work too? Great!)

Red glass is very hard to colour, the easiest & stablest way is using gold, therefore in the past and still to this day it is used in smaller amounts then almost any other colour. This makes red sea glass extremely hard to find and rare. 

These rare red pieces of sea glass were found by me on the beaches of Canada's West Coast. Red seaglass is most often from car tail lights, art glass or nautical & railroad lights and lanterns, and is only found once in about every 5,000 pieces.

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

Handmade in Victoria on Vancouver Island, West Coast of British Columbia, Canada.

Please direct questions to:
sandoverslydesign@gmail.com

name: Made in Japan. Sea Pottery and Cobalt Blue Sea Glass Necklace
description:
Deep cobalt blue sea glass teardrop dangles from the triple drilled beach from ceramic "Made in Japan" piece. This shard has quite some age to it.

Lovely sea pottery piece I found on a beach in Oak Bay on Vancouver Island. West Coast of Canada.

This necklace breathes new life to these once discarded elements. Eco-friendly, green jewelry! 

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

Handmade in Victoria on Vancouver Island, West Coast of British Columbia, Canada.

name: The Goddess, Deep Purple Sea Glass, Shell, Beach Pottery and Pyrite Neckace
description:
Deep purple sea glass, chunky pyrite, turquoise beach pottery, shell, kyanite, aqua sea glass, milky irredesent sea glass, handmade glass beads and labradorite.

The beautiful beach found sea glass and pottery I drill for use in my work was found by me on the beaches of Canada's west coast. 

All these element together with the gunmetal chain and decortive sterling silver headpin create quite a elegant necklace.

Add something different to your everyday with this gorgeous necklace.

Eco-friendly, green jewelry! 

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

Handmade in Victoria on Vancouver Island, West Coast of British Columbia, Canada.

name: Black Flower & Sea Foam Sea Glass Necklace
description:
One of a kind, sea glass, pyrite & black flower charm necklace. Nice, black coated metal chain. (lead & nickel free) 

This necklace has a little edge to it, but is very feminine. Made with westcoast found sea glass, pyrite gemstone, shell & black metal chain.

Sea glass I collected myself from a rugged beach on Canada's West Coast. Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. (Near Victoria, B.C.)

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

name: Vintage Pink Button Ring, Sz. 8
description:
Two darling pink buttons were used to create this vintage button ring.

Most buttons used are from the 1940's to late 70's, though some, especially shell buttons are even older (1890's).

These buttons are likely from the 60's & 70's.

Sweet one of a kind ring in size, 8!

Ring base is hand wrapped stainless steel wire, no glue involved.

This piece of artisan jewelry is hand crafted in Canada with sustainability and the earth in mind. Quality materials are used with all intentions of giving the wearer a long lasting piece of unique jewellery.

Shipped to you with care to ensure safe and speedy delivery.

Handmade in Victoria on Vancouver Island, West Coast of British Columbia, Canada.

www.sandoverslyjewelry.com/product/wholesale-order-of-20-button-rings

name: Wholesale Order of 20 Vintage Button Rings "Button Queen" by Sandover-Sly Jewelry
description:
20 random "Button Queen" button rings made of vintage plastic, bakelite, wood, mother of pearl, glass and metal buttons.

You will get 20 button rings in mostly sizes 7-9, also including some size 5, 6, 10. I have found the most common finger sizes are 7 and 8. All rings look wonderful worn of index, middle or pointer finger.

Just wonderful and eyecatching rings. Wire-wrapped with strong stainless steel wire. Always a popular item. All are one of a kind and unique.

More examples:
http://www.facebook.com/The.Button.Queen
